intro: Betonica clementei, commonly known as the Sierra betony, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of California. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Betonica clementei thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland and meadow habitats. It is a perennial herb that is relatively rare and of conservation interest due to its limited distribution.
